channel.title: GUI vs CLI
channel.description:
Okay I'm just curious as to what type of interface you guys prefer. GUI(Graphical User Interface)s or CLI(Command-Line Interface)s.
I personally prefer CLI because it seems you have more control over the logic, and it's cleaner. For example with my server, I can just ssh to it and type out all my commands, with the parameters I want, instead of using a GUI that may not have all the functionality I want, and assume the most "common" parameters during operation. You also don't have to worry about placement of components, and annoying features that the programmer may have added(like the old script for web browsers years ago that would have the title marquee)
What type do you prefer and why?

item.title: GUI vs CLI
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I say let the user choose. Minecraft does this so it can run with servers that don’t have GUI’s themselves, but it can also run in a GUI for people that like seeing detailed information

Read full topic

Newty:

If you planned on releasing it to a larger and more moronic user-base, such as moparscape

item.title: GUI vs CLI
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

It depends on the audience you intend to release it to. For example if you are the only one who is ever going to use the program in question then a CLI would suffice. If you planned on releasing it to a larger and more moronic user-base, such as moparscape, then a GUI would be needed for ease of access.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Same input really.[/quote]

Ok, works for me. Anyone have any suggestions on GUI frameworks? Aside from AWT and Swing that is.

Read full topic
